posts.post_content:
Nobody's commenting on the ruling text?   
  
"Unless something wierd happens, this card does what it says it does"  
  
I found that hilarious. Also, Jayemdae Tome is so good, and this is 'as good as' if you really value concealing your draws and 'better than' if you like paying your cards fast.  
  
I don't see why this doesn't rate at least 3 stars, and its usefulness in EDH ought to be worth a little more love. Not every card can be a super bomb, and this one does its job fairly well I think.
posts.html:

I found that hilarious. Also, Jayemdae Tome is so good, and this is 'as good as' if you really value concealing your draws and 'better than' if you like paying your cards fast.

I don't see why this doesn't rate at least 3 stars, and its usefulness in EDH ought to be worth a little more love. Not every card can be a super bomb, and this one does its job fairly well I think.

Posted By: DarthParallax (3/22/2012 6:45:15 AM)

posts.post_content: EDH is a format abbreviation, called Elder Dragon Highlander, referencing I suppose the Highlander film. Basically you pick a legendary creature and use it as your "general", and you can only play cards that share a color with it and colorless cards. Furthermore, you can only play one of each card, period, and the decks are 100 cards minimum if I recall correctly. So in an EDH deck, this card would basically be a guaranteed recursive cantrip.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Love this card in edh, draws me a bunch of cards as the game progresses and easy to cast when you have a little mana to spare.  
The "unless something weird happens" part would be in case you have an "if you would draw a card"-effect active. Also, something like [Chains of Mephistopheles](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chains of Mephistopheles), for example, could get rid of the card before you draw it ;)
